Text:
(It's the dawn of a new week, and the preliminary
rounds of the Bushin Festival are underway. Skel
and I are watching the matches from the stands.)
(It's still early, so the crowds are sparse.)

(That's the prelims for you. But I actually prefer
things this way because, the truth is, I fought twice
yesterday.)

(As for my third match, at this point I've got the
teensiest bit of leeway in terms of how good of a
show I can put on.)

(That's why I'm happy to have an audience even if
it's a small one. The real Bushin Festival starts with
the main tourney.)
Novices might bet on intuition, but not me.

I collected data, extract the statistics, and then
make my wager based on probability.
Gambling's all about coming out on top in total, see.

I don't win or lose the bet based on a single match—I
combine the chances and win in 10-match increments.
That's cuz I'm a man who knows how to work the odds.

And that's why, in order boost our chances to win to
100 percent, I'm gonna need some funds to—
What you said just now was very interesting.
He's Goldy Gilded the Unbeaten Legend!
Call me Goldy Gilded the Victorious Golden Dragon.

(Goldy sweeps back his hair and replies while Skel
looks on with glittering eyes.)
(I think I prefer the Unbeaten Legend myself.)
Yessir, Mister Joyfully Rare Animal, Goldy, sir!
Yessir, Mister Aged-for-10-Years Pinot Gris, sir!
It appears you're collecting battle data.

For you see, aggregate data is an essential part of
my perfect record as well.
O-Oh, I didn't know that, sir.
Yes... It's the key to victory...

Aw man, he's so cool! Please tell me more, Mister
Madame Butterfly, sir!

Good grief... Fine, but only a little. And again,
it's Victorious Golden Dragon.

(This seems like it's gonna drag on for awhile. Which
is perfect because it's about time for my match.)
I'm gonna go take a dump.

I theorize that you can get a good read on a
fighter's general ability before the battle starts.

That brazen countenance and the glint in his eyes
tell me that he's an experienced combatant. And one
glance at his balanced muscle mass makes his physical
might very clear.

It's a quantification of his combat ability. 1,364
isn't bad.
Nothing, it's just that he's so...

Could it be that he looks like a mega milquetoast
but is actually a dark horse...?

I can't fathom how he won his previous two fights.
His face, physique, and even aura are all so
pitifully weak.

In an instant, I'd assume. The match won't even be
worth watching.
Man, listen to that cool and clear-cut breakdown!
You're awesome, Mister Draughty Lagerson, sir!
